p: The antioxidant activity of the EO of M. officinalis was evaluated by the DPPH method. IC 50 is inversely related to the antioxidant capacity of a compound or essential oil, as it expresses the amount of antioxidant needed to decrease the concentration of the free radical by 50%. The lower the IC 50 value, the greater the antioxidant activity. The IC 50 values for the EO as well as for the reference compounds, BHT and BHA, alpha-tocopherol and vitamin E were presented in the Table 5. The IC 50 of M. officinalis essential oil was found to be more than 44,000 Âµg/mL.
